challenge.description: No superstructure detected despite strong Mg–Mn chemical contrast.
challenge.impact: Absence of superstructure limits the ability to induce cation ordering, which is critical for optimizing material properties.

solution.description: FTIR spectrum confirmed the absence of additional vibration bands, indicating that octahedral composition alone is insufficient to induce cation ordering.
solution.methodology: FTIR spectroscopy analysis of vibration modes.
solution.effectiveness: Provided clarity on the structural limitations but did not resolve the absence of superstructure.

evidence.data: FTIR spectrum showed no additional vibration bands, confirming lack of cation ordering.

context.material_properties: Strong Mg–Mn chemical contrast; octahedral composition (Mn1.5Mg0.5).
context.experimental_conditions: Solid-state reaction synthesis; FTIR spectroscopy analysis.
context.application_relevance: Cation ordering is essential for enhancing electrochemical performance in battery applications.

challenge.description: Extensive Li/Zn cation inversion observed, leading to additional high-frequency bands in IR and Raman spectra.
challenge.impact: Cation inversion alters the structural symmetry and affects the material's electrochemical properties.

solution.description: Rietveld refinement and spectroscopic analysis identified the cation distribution and its impact on structural symmetry.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully characterized the inversion but did not prevent or mitigate its occurrence.

evidence.data: IR peaks at 583 and 685 cm−1 attributed to cation distribution changes; Rietveld refinement confirmed Li/Zn inversion.

context.material_properties: Zn2+ has strong tetrahedral preference; significant Li/Zn inversion.
context.experimental_conditions: Solid-state reaction synthesis; IR and Raman spectroscopy analysis.
context.application_relevance: Cation inversion impacts structural stability and electrochemical performance in battery applications.

challenge.description: Presence of NiO impurity in synthesized sample.
challenge.impact: Impurity reduces phase purity, which can negatively affect electrochemical performance and structural integrity.

solution.description: Rietveld refinement included NiO impurity in structural analysis to improve statistical accuracy.
solution.methodology: Rietveld refinement of neutron diffraction data.
solution.effectiveness: Improved structural characterization but did not eliminate the impurity.

evidence.data: Rietveld refinement showed 1.6% NiO impurity in the sample.

context.material_properties: Ni substitution induces octahedral cation ordering; impurity affects phase purity.
context.experimental_conditions: Solid-state reaction synthesis; neutron diffraction analysis.
context.application_relevance: Phase purity is critical for consistent electrochemical performance in battery applications.

challenge.description: Large batch synthesis resulted in significant fraction of unreacted CuO impurity.
challenge.impact: Impurity compromises phase purity and structural integrity, affecting material performance.

solution.description: Impurities were accounted for in subsequent Rietveld refinements to improve structural analysis.
solution.methodology: Rietveld refinement of neutron diffraction data.
solution.effectiveness: Improved structural characterization but did not eliminate the impurity.

evidence.data: Large batch synthesis showed 6.2% CuO impurity in the sample.

context.material_properties: Cu substitution induces octahedral cation ordering; impurity affects phase purity.
context.experimental_conditions: Solid-state reaction synthesis; neutron diffraction analysis.
context.application_relevance: Phase purity is essential for reliable electrochemical performance in battery applications.

challenge.description: Minor amounts of LiGa5O8 impurity detected in synthesized sample.
challenge.impact: Impurity reduces phase purity, potentially affecting electrochemical performance and structural stability.

solution.description: Impurity was included in Rietveld refinement to improve structural characterization.
solution.methodology: Rietveld refinement of X-ray diffraction data.
solution.effectiveness: Improved structural analysis but did not eliminate the impurity.

evidence.data: Rietveld refinement showed 7% LiGa5O8 impurity in the sample.
